morphological_features.trilateral_roots: Most words derive from three-consonant roots
morphological_features.morphological_patterns: Extensive pattern system (فعل، فاعل، مفعول، etc.)
morphological_features.case_system: 3 cases (nominative, accusative, genitive) in formal Arabic
morphological_features.profanity_morphology: Profanity participates in full morphological system

phonological_features: 29 consonant phonemes including pharyngeal and glottal
Vowel system varies significantly across dialects
Dialect pronunciation variations affect written representation
script_complexities: Cursive script with contextual letter forms
Letters change shape based on position in word
Optional diacritics for vowels and pronunciation
RTL direction with LTR number insertion complications

profanity_characteristics: Most tolerant Arabic dialect for profanity

islamic_influence.description: Islam as the dominant religion shapes language attitudes
key_factors: Prophetic traditions about avoiding offensive language
contemporary_variations: Urban vs rural religious adherence patterns
Modern Islamic interpretations of language purity

honor_shame_culture.description: Traditional Arab cultural values emphasizing collective honor
core_concepts: Family honor (karama) central to social identity
linguistic_implications: Public language reflects on entire family

script_handling.contextual_forms: Required for proper Arabic script processing
script_handling.joining_behavior: Arabic letters join based on position

compilation_methodology.approach: Multi-dialectal compilation with Islamic cultural sensitivity and academic validation
quality_control: Native speaker review from multiple Arabic regions
Islamic jurisprudence consultation for religious content
Cultural appropriateness assessment across Arab societies
Political sensitivity review for regional contexts
coverage_areas: Family honor attacks and shame language
Internet culture and digital communication adaptations
validation_process: Academic peer review by Arabic linguistics experts
Legal compliance verification across Arab countries
Cultural impact assessment for different Arab societies

usage_notes.intended_use: Content moderation, profanity filtering, Arabic linguistics research, cultural sensitivity analysis
usage_notes.cultural_sensitivity: Requires deep understanding of Islamic values and Arab honor-shame culture
limitations: Limited coverage of some regional dialects
ethical_considerations: Awareness of Arab cultural diversity and regional differences
Balance between cultural accuracy and individual safety
special_considerations: Family honor insults can have serious real-world consequences
Religious blasphemy may violate local laws in many Arab countries
Political profanity severity varies dramatically by regime type
Sectarian tensions make ethnic/religious slurs particularly dangerous
Gender-based expectations create different filtering needs for male/female users
RTL script handling requires specialized technical implementation

legal_compliance.blasphemy_laws: Many Arab countries have strict blasphemy and religious offense laws
legal_compliance.cybercrime_legislation: Growing number of Arab countries with online harassment laws
legal_compliance.political_speech_restrictions: Authoritarian contexts require careful political content handling
legal_compliance.honor_protection_laws: Some jurisdictions have legal protections for family honor
legal_compliance.international_considerations: Diaspora communities subject to host country laws

maintenance_schedule.political_context_monitoring: Monthly (due to rapidly changing political situations)
maintenance_schedule.technical_script_updates: As needed for Unicode and RTL processing improvements
